Description: Lower body sherd and conical foot of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (partly worn); probable red or white band on lower wall; exterior: slip worn; trace of three rising rays or possible complete glazing; glazed streaky black on foot; inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: The Wild Goat Style Chian chalice has a heavy and low conical foot, with black slip on the exterior and reserved underside. The bowl, when preserved, is coated in black slip with no decoration.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 171, no. 57)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0164) (phase 2)
